Huaming Chen

Web: huaming-chen.com

About Me

Greetings! My name is Huaming Chen, currently a Ph.D candidate in University of Wollongong, Australia. I am advised by A/Prof. Jun Shen, A/Prof. Lei Wang from UoW, A/Prof. Jiangning Song from Monash and Dr. Chi-Hung Chi from CSIRO, Australia. I received my Master and Bachelor’s degree from Pro. Qingguo Zhou’s DSLab and Honors Class at Lanzhou University, in 2015 and 2012 respectively.

A Little More About Me

I am interested in the intersection of machine learning and biology systems. A broad area covering from the lower-level computer architecture, such as real-time Linux kernel development, driver development and computer operating systems, to the higher-level algorithms and statistical models including artificial intelligence, machine learning and bioinformatics, has been through my learning and practicing career. Relevant projects and publications can be found attached. During my spare time, it is my great pleasure to learn and share with new learning discovery. Details could be found in my blogs.

Presentation

The Seventh International Conference on Advanced Cloud and Big Data

Sep, 22, 2019

Topic: Leveraging SMOTE in A Two-Layer Model for Prediction of Protein-Protein Interactions

IEEE NSW and Centre for IT-enabled Transformation (CITT) Joint Seminar.

April 26, 2018

Topic: The Study between Host and Pathogen Interactions

Abstract: The rapid development of high throughput technologies has presented us an opportunity in mining and uncovering the relationships of the biological data. Specifically, the accumulated omics data expose a fundamental scenario for researchers with interest. In this study, we will discuss the topic on drilling computational methodologies to the proteomics study, specifically concerning the interactions between host and pathogens.
